description: From French vigilant or its source, Latin vigilans, present participle of vigilare (“stay awake”), from vigil (“awake”). Doublet of vigilante, from Spanish. Displaced Old English wacor.

adjectives.description: vigilant (comparative more vigilant, superlative most vigilant)

entries.meaning: Watchful, especially for danger or disorder; alert; wary
examples: Be vigilant for signs of disease in your garden.
